contentrichtext.text: {{about|the city in Nagano, Japan|the monitor and TV manufacturer|Iiyama (company)}} {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Iiyama |JapaneseName= 飯山市 |MapImage= Iiyama in Nagano prefecture.png |Region= [[Chūbu region|Chūbu]] ([[Kōshin'etsu region|Kōshin'etsu]]) |Prefecture= [[Nagano Prefecture|Nagano]] |District= |Area_km2= 202.32 |PopDate= April 2008 |Population= 23,969 |Density_km2= 118 |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 36 |LatitudeMinutes= 51 |LatitudeSeconds= |LongtitudeDegrees= 138 |LongtitudeMinutes= 22 |LongtitudeSeconds= |Tree= [[Japanese Beech]] |Flower= [[Camellia]] |Bird= [[Mandarin Duck]] |Butterfly= [[Luehdorfia japonica|Japanese Luehdorfia]] |SymbolImage= Flag of Iiyama, Nagano.png |SymbolDescription= Flag |Mayor= [[Masato Ishida]] |CityHallPostalCode= 389-2292 |CityHallAddress=1110-1, Ōaza Iiyama, Iiyama-shi, Nagano-ken |CityHallPhone= 0269-62-3111 |CityHallLink= [http://www.city.iiyama.nagano.jp/ Iiyama City] }} {{nihongo|'''Iiyama'''|飯山市|Iiyama-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Nagano Prefecture|Nagano]], [[Japan]]. It markets itself as "Japan's Hometown". The city was founded on August 1, 1954. As of 2008, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 23,969 and the [[population density|density]] of 118 persons per km². The total area is 202.32 km². The [[Chikuma River]] (the longest river in Japan) runs through the centre of the area and becomes known as the [[Shinano River]] when it passes into [[Niigata Prefecture]]. Contrary to a popular misconception{{Citation needed|date=June 2008}}, the city has no relationships with the TV and electronics manufacturer [[Iiyama (company)|Iiyama]]. ==Activities== There are many well known ski resorts in the area. These include [[Nozawa Onsen Snow Resort]], Madarao Sympathique, Madarao Kogen, Tangram Ski Circus, Togari Onsen, Shinanodaira, Iiyama Kokusai and Hokuryuko <ref>[http://myokokogen.net/madarao-kogen/ Madarao: The Heart of Japan]</ref> Iiyama also hosts a number of popular festivals such as the Iiyama Snow Festival in mid-February and Iiyama Dontokoi in August.<ref>[http://myoko-nagano.com/madarao/#events Madarao, Tangram and Iiyama Guide - Events]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat-inline}} * [http://www.city.iiyama.nagano.jp Iiyama official website] (Jp) * [http://www.iiyama-ouendan.net/english/index.html Iiyama Tourist Association] (Multilingual) * [http://www.geocities.jp/furusato_kitahara/ Iiyama website] (Jp) * [http://myoko-nagano.com/madarao/ Heart of Japan - Madarao] (En) {{Nagano}} [[Category:Cities in Nagano Prefecture]] {{Nagano-geo-stub}}
